tier_1_determinative.five_or_more_persons_committing_dacoity: The incident involved four persons entering the pig farm, with three carrying knives and one carrying an iron rod, which does not meet the requirement of five or more persons for dacoity as defined under IPC 395.

tier_2_material.property_stolen: 40 pigs and mobile phones were taken by the accused.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The incident occurred at a pig farm owned by Milind Ghare in Pune.
tier_3_contextual.incident_date_time: The incident occurred on the intervening night of 28th March 2018 and 29th March 2018.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Arjunsing Rajputsing Dudhani vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_respondent: Mr. S. V. Gavand, A.P.P for the Respondent â€“ State.
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Sections 395, 412 of IPC; Sections 4(25) and 27 of the Arms Act; Sections 3(1)(ii) and 3(4) of the Maharashtra Control of Organized Crime Act (MCOC Act).
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code, Arms Act, Maharashtra Control of Organized Crime Act

residual_details.additional_facts: The applicant, Arjunsing Rajputsing Dudhani, was seeking bail on the ground of parity, as similarly placed co-accused had been released on bail. The only material against the applicant was a confessional statement by co-accused Bacchansing Bhond, which was later retracted. There was no recovery of the stolen property at the instance of the applicant, and no Test Identification Parade was conducted. The court found no reasonable grounds to conclude that the applicant was part of the organized crime syndicate led by Lakkadsing Shitalsing Dudhani.
